data.name: label1.Text
data.value:
Welcome to the Information/Help section of this software
Information: This software assists in the calculation of parameters for NACA 4 digit and 5 digit aerofoil profiles in 2D using Thin Aerofoil theory.
The parameters can be calculated using either an Analytical solver method: The NACA aerofoil equations are solved analytically. or a Numerical solver method: The equations are integrated numerically using Simpsons rule.
This software calculates the following parameters:
The angle of attack at which the Aerofoil produces zero lift. The lift coefficient at the specified angle of attack. The pitching moment about the leading edge. The pitching moment about the aerodynamic centre.
The A0, A1 and A2 coefficient values for Thin Aerofoil theory.
Help: Input the desired NACA 4 digit or 5 digit Aerofoil code in the NACA box. Input the desired angle of attack in the AoA box (in degrees). Choose the desired solver method, along with the number of sub divisions for numerical integration if required.
Use the Solve button to perform the calculation and display the results. The specifications of the NACA aerofoil section selected are also displayed below the results.
The aerofoil section is plotted also, the "Render with AoA" box allows for the visualisation of the aerofoil section at the specified angle of attack.
This software was written by Jacob Currie - Student No. 201718558 For the module: ME529 Aerodynamics in C - Coursework No. 1.
Notable mentions - Dr. Stickland's class resources on MyPlace - airfoiltools.com
